article:
My old laptop was literally falling apart at the seams  . Though I took good care of it so that the wires wouldn't fall out, telling myself 21 _  to save important files so that they wouldn't be 22 _  when the computer died, one day the screen still went black. Then I looked online to see if there was a(n)23 _ . The series of steps involved seemed 24 _ , similar to hopping  on one foot while singing "My country, 'Tis of Thee" backwards. But it worked. The only problem was my battery could neither be charged nor 25 _ , so from then on I had to meet my deadlines.
That was 26 _ . Yet once I admitted it was inconvenient but not a(n) 27 _ , things got better in the end. I28 _  myself that in years past I'd worked on heavy desktop computers and thought29 _  of it. In college I'd typed on a typewriter. In high school I wrote with a pen.
Here's a fact: When I'm annoyed, it's usually a 30 _  that I've overlooked something in the thankfulness department. The only31 _  my laptop situation could even be annoying was that I had work to do.
Annoyances are real, and 32 _  are never the whole story. I complain in the long checkout line at the grocery store, forgetting that I get to wait 33 _  I have money to buy food. I become angry about   _   clothes after a sudden rain, overlooking the fact that we can't live without water. I glare at an interruption from my kids, 35 _  the astonishing fact that I have a large and loving family.
This morning I'm writing on a brand new laptop. It functions 36 _ , and every single letter on the keyboard works. I am thankful for how much 37 _  it is for me to do my work now.
To be honest, the annoyance of my laptop was 38 _ . It helped me remember that when life is inconvenient, I need to 39 _  annoyances as a hint   that I need to look at the situation from a different view, and 40 _  thanks.
